str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Feminine Singular
str2: The next day. Feminine singular participle of a comparative of epi and heimi; supervening, i.e. the ensuing day or night.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: To engage in battle, fight; hence: To strive, contend, dispute.

word: and he tried to reconcile them,
parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To compel, urge, force together. From sun and elauno; to drive together, i.e. exhort.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To act unjustly towards, injure, harm. From adikos; to be unjust, i.e. do wrong.

parse: Personal / Reciprocal Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: One another, each other. Genitive plural from allos reduplicated; one another.
